data.name: Saison De Maison
data.description: A refreshing French Saison, highlighted by rye, oats, and Hallertauer Mandarina hops. This beer finishes very dry, but still has a silky mouthfeel.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison de Moon
data.description: A farmhouse ale brewed annually for the Cheers to Belgian Beers event in portland. A classic farmhouse ale yeast strain will have belgian beer lovers drooling for the spicy malty character this ancient style has to offer. Available on draught only.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: Saison de Pamplemousse
data.description: Translating to Season of Grapefruit, this is a wheat saison brewed with a blend of belgian yeasts with Oroblanco and Ruby Red Grapefruit zest and juice added.

data.name: Saison de Paulus
data.description: Belgian-style saison fermented at high temperatures for a dry, spicy farmhouse ale. Bubbly and bright.

data.name: Saison de Pêsches
data.description: Barrel aged Saison

style.name: Brett Beer
style.description: Brett Beers are any range of color and may take on the color of added fruits or other ingredients. Chill haze, bacteria and yeast-induced haze are allowable at low to medium levels at any temperature. Moderate to intense yet balanced fruity-ester aromas are evident. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like aromas are subtly present. Diacetyl and DMS aromas should not be perceived. Hop aroma is evident over a full range from low to high. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like flavors are subtly present. Fruited versions will exhibit fruit flavors in harmonious balance with other characters. Hop flavor is evident over a full range from low to high. Hop bitterness is evident over a full range from low to high. The evolution of natural acidity develops balanced complexity. Horsey, goaty, leathery, phenolic and light to moderate and/or fruity acidic character evolved from Brettanomyces organisms may be evident, not dominant and in balance with other character. Cultured yeast strains may be used in the fermentation. Beers in this style should not use bacteria or exhibit bacteria-derived characters. Moderate to intense yet balanced fruity-ester flavors are evident. Diacetyl and DMS flavors should not be perceived. Wood vessels may be used during the fermentation and aging process, but wood-derived flavors such as vanillin must not be present. Residual flavors that come from liquids previously aged in a barrel such as bourbon or sherry should not be present. Body is evident over a full range from low to high. For purposes of competition entries exhibiting wood-derived characters or characters of liquids previously aged in wood would more appropriately be entered in other Wood-Aged Beer categories. Wood- and barrel-aged sour ales should not be entered here and are classified elsewhere.

data.name: Saison De Pom
data.description: The visit of the Arizona Wilderness friends was the source of inspiration for a collaboration between worlds, as well as between breweries. A little bit cider beer, the Saison de Pom is the one that could be enjoyed in an imaginary farmhouse with an annexed apple orchard ... rustic and fruity, dry and drinkable, a saison with a unique character.

data.name: Saison De Rose
data.description: Free Will’s breast cancer research charity beer – Saison de Rose – is a pink beer brewed with hibiscus flowers, grapefruit, and pink peppercorn. Proceeds of Saison de Rose benefit UPenn breast cancer research.

data.name: Saison de Ruisseau
data.description: We curse daily at this beer because it takes so long to ferment, but it's worth the wait, despite our emotional scarring.  This Belgian-style Saison has golden/light copper color, light body, medium hop bitterness, flavor & aroma, medium-low malt flavor & aroma and spiciness from added coriander.  Fruity esters dominate the aroma while complex alcohols, acidity, low Brettanomyces character and clove and smoke-like phenolics from Saison yeast.

data.name: Saison de Sangre
data.description: The Summer of Saison has been unleashed. Feast your curiosity on the all-new Saison de Sangre, our blood orange saison. This brew will ignite, enrage, and enliven your palate.

data.name: Saison De Silas
data.description: Richly reward yourself with Silas, a farmhouse ale with good moral character and light hearted attitude. Silas is designed for all occasions and will most definitely put a smile on your face after the first sip. A New Zealand hop focus, European malt character and brewers’ tears (of the happy kind) aid your journey into this smooth, joyful and crisp ale designed for all beer lovers. Continue that positive attitude or cheer up with Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s Saison de SILAS

data.description: A classic Saison recipe with hint of Lavender flowers and sour cherries

data.name: Saison de Walt
data.description: A complex Belgian farmhouse ale brewed in honor of a lost beer legend, Walt Powell. After fermentation, the Saison de Walt is blended with a beer that has been aging in wine barrels with the wild yeast Brettanomyces, further adding to the uniqueness of this very dry and complex ale

style.name: Belgian-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Belgian-style pale ales are characterized by low but noticeable hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Light to medium body and low malt aroma are typical. They are light amber to deep amber in color. Noble-type hops are commonly used. Low to medium fruity esters are evident in aroma and flavor. Low levels of phenolic spiciness from yeast byproducts may be perceived. Low caramel or toasted malt flavor is okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

data.name: Saison de Waterloo
data.description: The story of the Saison begins in Belgium’s Wallonian province, within which the municipality of Waterloo resides. We take pride in continuing the tale stateside, in Waterloo, IA. This carefully crafted chapter is home to no battle, as the rustic malt bill, bright hops and spicy Belgian yeast strain peacefully collaborate, scripting an intriguing, American influenced, farmhouse ale.

data.name: Saison De ‘Ron
data.description: Historically a beer to repay farmhands, this is a style that places emphasis on the yeast most predominantly. A spiced flavor flirts with grassy and floral hops lending depth and intrigue. It’s pale straw color of continental malts brings you back to the Belgian grain fields in which this style was conceived. The crisp, dry finish tumbles off the palate and pairs well with herb crusted chicken and wild mushrooms.

data.name: Saison Deluxe
data.description:
Stunningly complex with tropical fruit overtones of pineapple and passion fruit. Imported malt and hops create a smooth, earthy flavor on the palate. A farmhouse-style ale, SAISON DELUXE successfully combines traditional rustic flavor with a sophisticated craft-brewed taste.

2005 SILVER MEDAL Great American Beer Festival, Denver
1998 SILVER MEDAL Great American Beer Festival, Denver

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison des Fetes - Guava
data.description: This effervescent brew goes down easy in the summer heat. An ideal blend of rare Southern Star hops and pink guava. Each sip offers a dizzying array of guava and pineapple notes. A slight citrus tartness cleans up the aftertaste and leaves you wanting more.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: Saison des fetes - Nelson Sauvin
data.description: Our interpretation of this classical Belgian seasonal bridges old world techniques with new world innovation. The expression aroma of the unique yeast strain, the subtle balance and crisp mineral finish has been married with one of the most sought after hops in the world. Grown exclusively in New Zealand, Nelson Sauvin is renowned for its flavor of Viognier and muscat grapes. This is our most elegant and refined saison offering yet.

data.name: Saison Des Moines
data.description:
Many Iowans know firsthand that farming can be hot, physical work. The Saison beer style was first developed centuries ago to overcome poor water conditions and hydrate farm workers on hot days.

Saison Des Moines was created by our farm-boy-turned-head-brewer, John Martin, as a homage to the simple-but-elegant Saison DuPont. It’s built on Belgian pilsner malt and flaked wheat with east Kent Golding, Motueka and Citra hops plus French Saison yeast. This very effervescent brew has a light banana aroma with medium body that’s well attenuated, dry and fruity, with a pepper and clove aroma and flavor and a very slightly sour finish. Original Saison was very low alcohol, but ours packs a 7.5% ABV, so finish your chores before enjoying some!

data.description: A lovely farmhouse ale, lightly flavored with heather and lemon balm.

data.name: Saison des Pommes
data.description:
A combination French farmhouse style and hard cider made with locally grown apples.
Perhaps the most delicious and refreshing summer beer ever!

data.name: Saison Diego
data.description: Unfiltered golden farmhouse ale, brewed with Seville orange peels, Chinese ginger and grains of paradise. Light, bright, spicy aromas, lively carbonation and earthy flavors co-mingle with musty notes that add funky complexity.

data.name: Saison Dolores
data.description: Introducing Saison Dolores, Almanac’s newest year-round beer. A bright, aromatic brew for all seasons inspired by San Francisco’s Mission District. We combine barley, rye and Sonoran Wheat grown in Mendocino County and ferment the beer with our house Saison yeast. Finally we dry hop it to create a California Saison with flavors of spicy white pepper, fruity melon and a clean food friendly finish.
data.foodPairings: Enjoy this lively aromatic farmhouse ale with fresh seafood, funky washed rind cheeses and classic french-style charcuterie.

data.name: Saison du Berliner Weisse
data.description: Nice blend of the acclaimed Saison Du Flounder and a Berliner Weisse. The esthery funk of the Saison combined with the sour funk of the Berliner Weiss create a nice, thirst quenching, tartly sour, lemon citrus beer. We paired it with home made fruit reduction syrups - Raspberry, Strawberry, and also Woodrough for tradition!

data.name: Saison Du Blé (Blend #8)
data.description: Saison du Blé is the harmony of a fluffy Wheat Saison and a traditional, rustic Saison with Brettanomyces and Lactobacillus. The wheat balances a very dry body with a creamy, billowy mouthfeel, and our house Saison yeast adds complexity and acidity.

data.name: Saison Du Blodget
data.description: The only beer that combines the hop forward Five with barrel aging, Saison du Blodget has a historic profile melding tartness and bitterness. The wild aroma is rooted in the mix of hop notes and spent peaches from the Fantasia, which also contribute unique yeasts and bacteria.

data.name: Saison du BUFF
data.description:
The idea for this beer germinated way back in 2003 when the three guys (Sam from Dogfish, Greg from Stone and Bill from Victory) formed the BUFF alliance (Brewers United for Freedom of Flavor) - a noble endeavor with the goal to highlight the passion and camaraderie of the American craft brew movement.

So, BUFF didn't really do anything (beyond talk a lot of talk) until 2010 when the three brewers finally got together to jointly brew at beer at the Stone Brewery. Saison du BUFF was first brewed at Stone and then replicated at each of the other two breweries - same recipe, same ingredients, three different breweries

data.name: Saison du Buff
data.description:
This beer is collaboration between Dogfish Head, Stone Brewing Co. (Escondido, CA) and Victory Brewing Company (Downingtown, PA).
The idea for this beer germinated way back in 2003 when the three guys (Sam from Dogfish, Greg from Stone and Bill from Victory) formed the BUFF alliance (Brewers United for Freedom of Flavor) - a noble endeavor with the goal to highlight the passion and camaraderie of the American craft brew movement.
So, BUFF didn't really do anything (beyond talk a lot of talk) until 2010 when the three brewers finally got together to jointly brew at beer at the Stone Brewery. Saison du BUFF was first brewed at Stone and then replicated at each of the other two breweries - same recipe, same ingredients, three different breweries throughout 2010. 

Saison du BUFF is a Saison brewed with parsley, sage, rosemary and thyme. The beer is brewed three times, once at each brewery using the same recipe.

data.name: Saison Du Clue
data.description: Saison Du Clue is a French farmhouse style ale with a California twist. We dry hop it with a blend of Czech Saaz and Northwest Citra hops to give this beer a delightfully complex flavor and aroma.

Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison du Crue
data.description:
Brewers Whim #1


Belgian saisons have been brewed for as long as memory in the French speaking Wallonia region of Belgium. Traditionally crisp and refreshing beers for the summer months, each saison took on a unique character from the time and place it was brewed. Keeping that in mind Upstream's brewers bring you the Saison du Crue, literally season of high water, to mark the passing of this historic summer. This beer presents a pleasant sweet malt body with a hint of rye, balanced by moderate hopping and grains of paradise for a perfect summer quencher.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison du Flounder
data.description: Our yeast guy (East Coast Yeast) came up to us and asked if we'd like to try a new crazy yeast of his....to which we replied, OF COURSE! Middle Flounder brother Daniel and cousin Billy are both huge fans of the belgian-esque families of beers, so creating our own Saison was something that was certainly going to be in the cards - and here is our first! This Saison is all about showing off the fantastic yeast strain while keeping a nice, smooth, drinkable Saison that we can use to introduce folks into a whole new family of beers! It won the 2014 NJ Big Brew Winter Beer festival PEOPLE'S CHOICE award!

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
